page.title: 02 The River Winterborne.
page.content: The water table in the valley bottom changes very much during the year. In the winter the water level is only about twenty centimetres below the school, but in the summer it can be eighteen to twenty metres below.The high water levels usually come in February and this is when the river starts running. The River Winterborne rises at Winterborne Houghton and joins the River Stour at Sturminster Marshall. The river is a clean chalk stream and there are two trout farms along the length. The river is usually dry by the end of June.One year,1976, the river did not run at all because it was a very dry winter.Before the river bed was dug out about 60 years ago the village was flooded every winter and the children could not go to school.
